titlestmt.titleproper: Hall (Doris D.) collection of travel and recreation ephemera and La Dow family documents
Finding aid for the Doris D. Hall Collection of Travel and Recreation Ephemera and La Dow Family Documents LSC.1936
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Kelly Besser, 2021.

p.date: Online finding aid last updated 2021 January 19.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-04-17 15:29:46 -0700.

did.unittitle: Doris D. Hall collection of travel and recreation ephemera and La Dow family documents
did.abstract: Doris D. Hall was a resident of Los Angeles, California. This collection consists of printed materials related to travel and recreation within California and the greater U.S., ephemera, and home entertainment products of the 1930s-1980s. Also included are the La Dow Family papers which consist of legal documents.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

custodhist.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
custodhist.p: Gift from Doris D. Hall, July 24, 1999.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Doris D. Hall collection of travel and recreation ephemera and La Dow family documents (Collection 1936). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing note
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Problematic Content and Description in UCLA's Library Collections and Archives.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: A native of Los Angeles, Doris D. Hall (1912-2011) was born Doris Marie D'Ooge and grew up in Inglewood. Her mother Josephine D'Dooge (n√©e Wright) was from Massachusetts and her father was from Michigan. Doris married Harvey R. Hall (1905-1998) and they lived in the city of Los Angeles throughout their lives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of printed materials related to travel and recreation within California and the greater U.S., including such items as maps, travel guides and menus, as well as ephemera, and home entertainment products of the 1930s-1980s. Also included are the La Dow Family papers which consist of legal documents. The connection between the Hall family and the La Dow documents isn't clear.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Travel guide on the Union and Central Pacific railroad includes descriptions of railroad routes and points of interest.

did.unittitle: The Century Illustrated Monthly Magazine, vol. XLVII, no. 1

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Booklet on Inglewood events, pamphlets on the El Camino Real Bell, Old Los Angeles, and Hotel Franciscan in San Francisco, guide to Los Angeles area recreation, map of El Pueblo de Los Angeles State Park, and a copy of the Centenial Edition of "California Highways and Public Works" (vol. 29, nos. 9,10).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Menus from "Aladdin Studio Tiffin" in San Francisco and "Gestith Restaurant."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes copy of "Etiquette, Entertaining and Good Sense," assorted pamphlets on sermons, how to be a succesful teacher, what to say in a rental ad. Also guides for gas and energy use.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Old business cards, membership card for California Congress of Parents and Teachers, Inc., timetables and itinerary for Union Pacific trip.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Sound Products" was based in Hollywood, California.

did.unittitle: Home entertainment equipment publications and clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes manuals, mailers, a 1978 issue of Popular electronics and materials on Splitdorf radios, Metzner turntables, Western Electric Switch Mate, and Bell and Howell 16mm projectors.

did.unittitle: Issue of Los Angeles Times "West" magazine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes a corporation dead, estate documents and chiropractic licenses.
